description.narrative:
Overall objective: Livelihoods, health and life quality improved on a sustainable basis for returnees, protracted IDPs and vulnerable host communities
The programme have six outcomes: Outcome 1 (WASH): Returnees, IDPs and their host communities have access to and use safe drinking water on a sustainable basis, with water points being operated and maintained by communities Outcome 2 (WASH): Returnees, IDPs and their host communities have improved hygiene and sanitation behaviour and practices Outcome 3 (WASH): WASH partners at national and sub-national level have improved capacity to implement successful WASH interventions Outcome 4 (Agriculture-based Natural Resources Management): Vulnerable farmers and producers from among the returnees, IDPs and host communities have increased environmentally sustainable agricultural productivity and production Outcome 5 (Employment and Business Creation): Sustainable income-generating and livelihood opportunities for vulnerable youth have been created in a conflict sensitive manner, leading to jobs, income, and creation of small businesses. Outcome 6 (Women’s Empowerment): Vulnerable women from among the returnees, IDPs and their host communities have access to social, and economic resources, and capacity to empower women
